required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of the Ellume® Respirio Flu Test and the Ellume® eLab Flu Test for the Rapid Identification of Influenza A/B
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Multi-centre Study of the Ellume® Respirio Flu Test and the Ellume® eLab Flu Test Performance Versus Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) for the Rapid Detection of Influenza A/B

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary purpose of this study is to validate the sensitivity and specificity of the Respirio Flu Test and the eLab Flu Test in detecting Influenza A as compared to the gold standard for detection, Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR).
The secondary aims are to:
Validate the sensitivity and specificity of the Respirio Flu Test and the eLab Flu Test in detecting Influenza B as compared to the gold standard for detection, Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR); Evaluate the correct interpretation of the Respirio Flu Test by subjects with influenza-like symptoms; Evaluate the subjects' satisfaction with the convenience, comfort and ease of use of the Respirio Flu Test.

primary_outcome.measure: Of participants positive for influenza A by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are positive for influenza A by Respirio Flu Test.
primary_outcome.description: Establish sensitivity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

primary_outcome.measure: Of participants positive for influenza A by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are positive for influenza A by eLab Flu Test.
primary_outcome.description: Establish sensitivity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

primary_outcome.measure: Of participants negative for influenza A by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are negative for influenza A by Respirio Flu Test.
primary_outcome.description: Establish specificity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

primary_outcome.measure: Of participants negative for influenza A by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are negative for influenza A by eLab Flu Test.
primary_outcome.description: Establish specificity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Of participants positive for influenza B by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are positive for influenza B by Respirio Flu Test.
secondary_outcome.description: Establish sensitivity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Of participants positive for influenza B by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are positive for influenza B by eLab Flu Test.
secondary_outcome.description: Establish sensitivity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Of participants negative for influenza B by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are negative for influenza B by Respirio Flu Test.
secondary_outcome.description: Establish specificity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Of participants negative for influenza B by Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR), the percentage who are negative for influenza B by eLab Flu Test.
secondary_outcome.description: Establish specificity against a gold standard. Report as a percentage of participants with 96% confidence limits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of participants who correctly interpret result of Respirio Flu Test.
secondary_outcome.description: Agreement between trained staff and participants. Report as a percentage of participants with 95% confidence limits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scores from questionnaire to assess ease of use, comfort and convenience of Respirio Flu Test.
secondary_outcome.description: The ease of use questionnaire will provide total number of responses to each question and the percentage of participants selecting each response (on a 5 point Likert scale).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Respirio Flu Test and eLab Flu Test
arm_group.description: Upper respiratory tract samples from participants will be tested with: Respirio Flu Test; eLab Flu Test; and Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR)

intervention.description: The Respirio Flu Test is a rapid in vitro diagnostic test for the detection of influenza A or influenza B in nasal secretions. The Respirio Flu Test is designed to be simple to use and generates a result within 20 minutes.
intervention.arm_group_label: Respirio Flu Test and eLab Flu Test

intervention.description: The eLab Flu Test is an in vitro diagnostic test intended to be used at point-of-care for the detection of influenza A or influenza B in nasopharyngeal swab samples. The eLab Flu Test generates a result within 10 minutes.
intervention.arm_group_label: Respirio Flu Test and eLab Flu Test

intervention.description: Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) is a molecular diagnostic technique for the detection and identification of influenza viruses, both for clinical samples and isolates. The reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) allows template viral RNA to be reverse transcribed producing complementary DNA (cDNA) which can then be amplified and detected.
intervention.arm_group_label: Respirio Flu Test and eLab Flu Test

overall_official.affiliation: Australian Paediatric Pharmacology Research Unit, Royal Children's Hospital
University of Sunshine Coast Clinical Trials Centre

facility.name: Clinical Trials Centre - University of the Sunshine Coast
